options.label: Writing that readers can understand and use the first time

questions.rationale: Plain language is writing that your intended readers can understand and use the first time they read it.

questions.stem: Which are benefits of plain language? (Select all that apply)
questions.rationale: Plain language saves time, reduces errors, builds trust, and saves money. It does not make writing less professional.

questions.stem: Which sentence better focuses on the reader?

options.label: The department has revised its policies.
A new system has been implemented.
Changes have been made to the program.

questions.rationale: Lead with what matters most to your reader—in this case, the benefit increase.

questions.stem: ___ must submit your application by March 31.
questions.rationale: Using 'you' makes writing more direct and personal.

questions.stem: Match complex words with their plain alternatives:
questions.rationale: Simple, familiar words communicate more effectively than complex alternatives.

questions.text: Please submit your future plans for the upcoming year
questions.rationale: 'Future plans' is redundant—all plans are for the future. Just use 'plans'.

questions.stem: Which is more specific and clear?

options.label: Submit your application in a timely manner

questions.rationale: Specific dates are clearer than vague time references.

options.label: The report was written by the consultant.
Writing of the report was done by the consultant.

questions.rationale: Active voice puts the doer (consultant) before the action (wrote).

questions.stem: Which techniques help write clearer sentences? (Select all)

options.label: Keep sentences under 20 words on average

questions.rationale: Short sentences, main idea first, and positive language all improve clarity.

questions.stem: The average sentence length for plain language should be ___-20 words.
questions.rationale: Aim for an average of 15-20 words per sentence for optimal readability.

questions.stem: Which heading is more descriptive and helpful?
questions.rationale: Descriptive headings help readers find information quickly.

questions.stem: Which design elements help readers scan documents? (Select all)
questions.rationale: Short paragraphs, subheadings, and lists help readers scan effectively.

questions.stem: What's the best way to test if your document works?

options.label: Ask your colleagues to review it
Test with people who represent your actual audience

questions.rationale: Testing with real representatives of your audience provides the most valuable feedback.

questions.stem: What Flesch Reading Ease score should you aim for in plain English?
questions.rationale: Aim for a Flesch Reading Ease score of 60 or higher for plain English.
